授業方法:
Interactive discussion, student-led reading assignments, independent research. Regular attendance is expected -- students must contact the instructor via e-mail anytime they plan on being absent from class.

Plagiarism or turning in assignments written by generative software (e.g. Chat GPT) will result in an F for the course.

Submit Graduation Thesis to SIS electronically and to the seminar instructor via e-mail by Dec. 20th. (Late submission of the final draft will result in a penalty of -20% on the final graduation thesis grade.)
トピック.授業外学習2:
The graduation thesis requires a great deal of independent study and research, and due dates for the rough draft and final draft are strictly enforced: late submission of the rough draft will result in a penalty of -20% on the overall seminar grade, and submitting the final draft after Dec. 20 will result in a penalty of -20% on the final graduation thesis grade. This means that students will need self-discipline and self-management skills in this course.

Plagiarism or turning in a thesis written by generative software (e.g. Chat GPT) will result in a grade of 0 (an "F").

評価.教科書Required texts0: Reading assignments will be selected on a weekly basis.
評価.学位授与の方針との関連Relationship to Diploma Polic:
各授業科目は、各学部・研究科の定めるディプロマ・ポリシー（DP）・カリキュラム・ポリシー（CP）に基づき、カリキュラム上に配置されています。
DP・CPを意識して本授業科目の学修を進めることで、各学部・研究科の期待する能力が養成されます。
各学部・研究科のDP、CPや教育課程表（授業科目一覧等）は、下記リンクこちらに掲載していますので学修計画の参考にしてください。
